title: Swiss Bar Fire Likely Caused By Sparklers, Authorities Say
summary: Fireworks attached to bottles of Champagne sent up showers of sparks that appear to have ignited insulation in a bar. The blaze killed 40 people.

title: There Was Probably a Flashover in the Swiss Bar Fire. Here’s What That Means.
summary: A flashover is an event where an entire room is rapidly engulfed in flames.

title: In Trump’s Second Year, Congress Weighs How to Reassert Its Power
summary: Lawmakers head into President Trump’s second year facing questions about whether they can reclaim congressional clout in the face of his power grab.

title: After Watergate, the Presidency Was Tamed. Trump Is Unleashing It.
summary: In the 1970s, Congress passed a raft of laws to hold the White House accountable. President Trump has decided they don’t apply to him.

title: Stephen Schwartz Criticizes Kennedy Center, Saying He Won’t Host Gala
summary: The Washington National Opera said the “Wicked” composer was scheduled to host its annual event at the center this spring.

title: Trump Super PAC Raised More Than $100 Million in Recent Months
summary: The haul highlights how the president’s team has continued aggressive fund-raising from donors with interests before the administration.

title: Israeli Government Accuses Mamdani of Antisemitism Over Canceled Orders
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani of New York canceled executive orders issued by his predecessor that had barred city agencies from boycotting Israel and defined some criticism of Israel as antisemitic.

title: Democratic Socialists Celebrate Mayor Mamdani With a Rave in Brooklyn
summary: Democratic Socialists gathered at a Bushwick dance club to celebrate as one of their members began to govern New York City.

title: Mamdani Creates Office to Encourage Public Participation in Government
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani of New York said he hoped to reach communities that had been left out of the process.

title: ‘Chinese Peptides’ Are the Latest Biohacking Trend in the Tech World
summary: The gray-market drugs flooding Silicon Valley reveal a community that believes it can move faster than the F.D.A.

title: Boredom Is the Latest Online Trend Trying to Sharpen Young People’s Short Attention Spans
summary: Boredom, or an approximation of it, is an online trend for young people trying to sharpen their attention spans.

title: A Study Is Retracted, Renewing Concerns About the Weedkiller Roundup
summary: Problems with a 25-year-old landmark paper on the safety of Roundup’s active ingredient, glyphosate, have led to calls for the E.P.A. to reassess the widely used chemical.

title: Trump Says He Takes a High Daily Dose of Aspirin. How Safe Is That?
summary: Despite his doctors’ recommendations, President Trump takes a high dose.

title: California’s Latest Storm Brings Flooding to San Francisco Bay Area
summary: The state has seen a nonstop run of storms in recent weeks. This one is expected to bring heavy rain through the weekend.

title: Diane Crump, First Woman to Ride in Kentucky Derby, Dies at 77
summary: She was the first professional female jockey to compete at a track in the United States where betting was legal, and notched up 228 career victories.

title: Saks C.E.O. Steps Down as Company Struggles to Pay Down Debt
summary: Saks Global’s executive chairman, Richard Baker, is taking over the luxury retailer he created with the 2024 acquisition of Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman.

title: Coast Guard Suspends Search for Survivors of Latest Boat Strikes
summary: The service said that conditions in the area where the search was taking place included nine-foot seas and winds approaching 50 miles per hour.

title: Oil Tanker Fleeing U.S. Coast Guard Broadcasts Location in North Atlantic
summary: Russia requested this week that the United States end its pursuit of the vessel, which was intercepted in the Caribbean on its way to pick up oil in Venezuela.

title: Carrying for a Cause: Meet the Man Lugging Shelter Dogs Around New York
summary: Bryan Reisberg built a social media following in the millions by carrying his corgi, Maxine, in a backpack. Now, he carries shelter dogs.

title: Trump Is the Jan. 6 President
summary: Tragically, America is still living in a political era that began on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Self-Driving Cars Can’t See Without Their Eyes
summary: The unseen workers who help train A.I.

title: Federal Appeals Court Says California Open-Carry Ban Is Unconstitutional
summary: A Ninth Circuit panel said the ban ran afoul of a 2022 Supreme Court ruling that required courts to evaluate gun laws based on the country’s “historical tradition of firearm regulation.”

title: Lenny Dykstra Faces Charges After Police Find Drugs During Traffic Stop
summary: The Pennsylvania police did not say what charges would be filed against the former baseball star. His lawyer said the drugs were not Mr. Dykstra’s.

title: Software Error Will Force 325,000 Californians to Replace Real IDs
summary: Some state-issued identification cards issued to legal immigrants could be valid longer than the people holding them are allowed to remain in the United States, state officials said.

title: 2 Navy Service Members Accused of Entering Sham Marriages With Chinese Nationals
summary: Federal prosecutors say two female service members are facing fraud charges after having accepted thousands of dollars for the marriages.
